title: Error: No available formula with the name ".../homebrew-core/Aliases/python"

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

body:
### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 3.6.1-58-g7a14ae6
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: 7a14ae61874770d9ceaee716f90e19c3b5674caa
Last commit: 3 days ago
Core tap ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core
Core tap HEAD: 2427a1e537e71d53412b6b3364f8d3c5f9a7f750
Core tap last commit: 4 hours ago
Core tap branch: master
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_DISPLAY: :1
HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: set
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 4
Homebrew Ruby: 2.6.8 => /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/2.6.8_1/bin/ruby
CPU: quad-core 64-bit sandybridge
Clang: 14.0.6
Git: 2.34.1 => /bin/git
Curl: 7.81.0 => /bin/curl
Kernel: Linux 5.15.0-47-generic x86_64 GNU/Linux
OS: Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS (jammy)
Host glibc: 2.35
/usr/bin/gcc: 11.2.0
/usr/bin/ruby: 3.0.2
glibc: N/A
gcc@11: N/A
xorg: N/A
```


### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: Some installed formulae are deprecated or disabled.
You should find replacements for the following formulae:
  isl@0.18

Warning: "config" scripts exist outside your system or Homebrew directories.
`./configure` scripts often look for *-config scripts to determine if
software packages are installed, and which additional flags to use when
compiling and linking.

Having additional scripts in your path can confuse software installed via
Homebrew if the config script overrides a system or Homebrew-provided
script of the same name. We found the following "config" scripts:
  /home/hwapx/.nix-profile/bin/pkg-config
```


### Verification

- [X] I ran `brew update` and am still able to reproduce my issue.

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

Upgrading my packages like i do every week `brew upgrade`

### What happened (include all command output)?

Error: No available formula with the name "/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Homebrew/Library/Taps/homebrew/homebrew-core/Aliases/python".

### What did you expect to happen?

Packages to be upgraded normally

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
Just install home brew on a nix system and run `brew upgrade`
```
